The trick? Itâ€™s that sneaky little pointer-events property! Slapping it directly on the :view-transition allows us to click â€œunderâ€ the pseudo-element, meaning the full page is interactive even while the view transition is running.

::view-transition {
  pointer-events: none;
}

I always, always, always forget about pointer-events, so thanks to Bramus for posting this little snippet. I also appreciate the additional note about removing the :root element from participating in the view transition:

:root {
  view-transition-name: none;
}

He quotes the spec noting the reason why snapshots do not respond to hit-testing:

Elements participating in a transition need to skip painting in their DOM location because their image is painted in the corresponding ::view-transition-new() pseudo-element instead. Similarly, hit-testing is skipped because the elementâ€™s DOM location does not correspond to where its contents are rendered.
